content.description:
Climb the slabby wall at the left of the steep face directly.

The difficulties soon ease after the start.

This route is a bit tricky for me. Start off at the crack on the right (my friends tell me the right wall is off-route, but use it if you need it) Go up and find some small pockets out left with small feet. Trust me, the footholds are there, they just are microscopic. The crux, I feel, is making it to the tiny pocket with the right sequence. Definitely hit it with your right hand, otherwise it messes everthing up. Continue with a hard cross-through to some good two-finger holes and then go left to connect with Pocket Rib (V1)
content.location: Very last route all the way to the right. Look for lots of black streaks on the rock and is to the right of the blunt arete (Pocket Rib)

content.description: Sit start at the jug and then gain a good sharp two finger pocket with the left.   Pull though to better holds for the right hand then continue on improving holds up and slightly left.
Climb the blunt arete. Hard moves from the start but it gets easier as you go. The moves are a bit committing, I felt like the rock was going to break, but just trust it, it's good.
content.protection: pads and a good spotter. Bad landing
content.location: Follow the rock formation all the way to the right. Look for the black-streaked arete.

content.description:
Climb the arete either on the left side or if you are looking for something more challenging, go up the right side.

The climb is pretty easy, but the rock isn't very solid as you get towards the top.
content.protection: Highball so you'll want a few pads.
content.location: To the right of the crack

content.description: Sit start at the good jug.  Reach up left then lean out right and follow the wall and thin crack to the top, using pockets a crimp or two for the right and the crack for the left.
content.location: Just left of center of the main wall

content.description:
Climb the crack on good jams until an awkward exit gains the top.

Tall.
